ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: What didn't I learn from this class!! I learned about transnationality and how transnational approaches are crucial to all forms of analysis.
A way of looking at feminist and queer struggles through a transnational lense

I entered this class with high hopes of understanding queer and feminist theories better, and to say the least, my expectations have been met and surpassed. I am more insightful over how gender and sexuality connect to everything, such as immigrant familial structures.

I learned a lot about the world and the best lense to view it from. It taught us the danger of homogenizing different groups and not to understand the world through a Western lense full od standards. It also taught a lot about the different ways that love has evolved in the world and what effects modern technology has on the rest of the world as well as the effect of the West on the rest of the world.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Everything about this class is a strength!
Great course and the readings and work assigned were very appropriate and helpful. The live course was a bit too long for a seminar format, which made it hard to focus in the last half hour or so

I think th content itself was very interesting and the discussions as a result were a lot of fun everyday. Everyone was engaged. Technology was an issue but in the future in non-Zoom classes hopefully it will not be the same. The other main weakness was the amount of time per class- but again I think that is a result of Zoom.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 1000000%. Even if you have taken no WGSS courses before (I hadn't), Prof. Savci creates a wonderful learning environment, and her discussion questions really make you digest the material in a way other courses have not demanded. Your assumptions about the way the world works will be challenges by this course, which is always a good thing.

Absolutely!! If you are an ER&M or WGSS major or interested in feminist and queer studies you MUST take this course. Additionally, if you are in the human rights program, you can petition to have it count as an elective because it complements the required gateway course SO well!!!
Yes! Will give you a whole new way of approaching global issues that you may think you understand already.

Yes I would recommend this class, as it really intellectually stimulated me and it was interesting. It talked about many things that are not usually talks about very often and for that reason it was that much more interesting.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
